website_summaries.verdict: The incredible level of control that users have over this drawing tablet makes it an excellent option for professional digital artists.
cons: No tactile buttons or wheel on the tablet itself

customer_reviews.title: Finally...
customer_reviews.text: Finally, screen tablet that is accurate, sensitive, not plagued with bugs, and reasonably priced! I wont leave a long review because others have got that covered. Suffice to say the things I needed in a tablet (for industrial design sketching/rendering) are all here to such a great degree that I really enjoy using it. Pressure sensitivity is good, just as importantly 'initial activation pressure' is very light. This is essential for me because I do light underlays for most of my sketches. Accuracy--dead accurate, cursor goes right at the tip of the nib Drivers; no issues, everything works as intended without workflow-breaking bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Northorn

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing Immersion
customer_reviews.text: For the past 5 years, I've been using those basic/affordable Wacom drawing pads. And although I got used to it, there is a disconnect to them. You're drawing on one hand, but your eyes are looking up at a screen. This is my first drawing monitor tablet, and good lord this was the right choice. Total immersion, no disconnect. The screen is matte, so no harsh glossy reflections from other light sources in the room to distract you. My art has greatly improved to a degree I have never imagined. Although higher priced tablets does not inherently improve your illustration skills (practicing does), a monitor tablet such as this makes you feel much more comfortable and focused when drawing.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Great drawing experience, but the screen isn't up to par
customer_reviews.text: Very easy and fun drawing experience. I noticed a huge difference with the 8k levels of pen pressure compared to my old Intuos with its 2k. Screen itself feels great to draw on. However I ended up returning it because the display itself isn't up to snuff. The color accuracy just isn't there and the screen is fairly dim. At this sort of price you'd at least expect a good IPS panel on it. In any case I ended up just going with a new Intuos Pro instead. It's still fairly price but the Pro Pen 2 is really worth it.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: It gets easily scratched so take precaution!
customer_reviews.text: I got this tablet and I was excited about it. I opened and boom in the first week already a scratch. No big deal I just ignored it and the thing just feels like a scratch magnet. God I expected much better quality from Wacom.
customer_reviews.author: Jose J.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to setup. Needs to be connected to another screen to be used
customer_reviews.text: It was horribly hard trying to set this up. I also wish I knew that for it to work it needs to be connected to another screen. Can’t be used alone like another tablet would. It was also a more difficult setup. Super annoyed I’m stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clip Studio Paint Pro not included as advertised on the image
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Wacom Cintiq 16 Drawing Tablet with Screen (DTK1660K0A) Plus Slim pen option, which says the Bonus gift of Clip Stufio Paint Pro is included. However, I have not received any license info for Paint Pro but could only access a 1-mo free trial with monthly or yearly payment after. This is a wrong advertisement with a fake promise. Besides, the software installation process was far from being intuitive and the website was not organized at all (all drivers and software listed on one page, and customer cannot figure out what is the right software for you) and it took me several hours - while I am an computer engineer myself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but lots of cords
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an Intuos 4 and I love the tablet. I just wasn't prepared for two different cords. There's a lot going on. The one cord has a pigtail at the end with 3 connections, the second is for the power. My previous tablet, only had the one cord. It makes sense about having the power cord, I just didn't think about it. It connected to my MacBook Pro easily and I was up and running quickly. It's great for some of the detail for photo editing. Glad I made the jump, it's just doesn't travel as well as I hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Gina B

customer_reviews.title: A bit too small for my needs
customer_reviews.text: The tablet itself works great, but the 1080p resolution and screen size feels too limiting for my needs. When you open up a program like Zbrush or Clip Studio, the actual canvas size is not that big. Ended up returning this one and opted for the Cintiq Pro 24 instead, which is much more usable and well worth the extra cost. That being said, I think this Cintiq is great for someone who simply wants the device as a hobby or just to get started. In general, though, I think I would personally prefer to work on an intuos and larger 4k screen.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S. Giovannini

customer_reviews.title: Where the Enthusiast becomes a Professional.
customer_reviews.text: Very very good! It's essentially a Wacom tablet with a screen. Though I'd still recommend going with a Cintiq 22HD if you're serious about your career, it's still more than you need to create! Colors aren't the best. Refresh rate is only 60hz. You'll also need to buy a stand. Do keep in mind, however, that it has no buttons or shortcut keys like other products do. It's literally just a screen you can draw on, so hopefully you have a keyboard or can buy a mini keyboard to access and perform macros.
customer_reviews.author: Hollow

customer_reviews.title: Works intermittenly at best
customer_reviews.text: Great screen size, but unfortunately with Windows 10, I've had more problems than enjoyment with this tablet. Between Windows updates screwing the tablet up, the tablet not being recognized, losing all settings, drivers being corrupted, the pen stops working randomly, the pen calibration never stays, the pen sensitivity settings never stay. More problems than it was worth. I would return it if I could and stay away from these products moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: heightsnjdc

customer_reviews.title: Way Better Than the  Last Drawing Tablet
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased to facilitate my online teaching. I plugged it in, followed the instructions, and set up was a breeze. I played around with it and Adobe Illustrator as well as the Windows Ink Whiteboard and am very happy with the results. The pen was aligned to the screen perfectly. With the last drawing tablet the pen would not align, so it went back. It was considerably less expensive than the Wacom, but I guess we get what we pay for. It's not about me, anyway. It's about my students.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Awesome when it works
customer_reviews.text: You want accuracy when you draw? This is it. You want it to work without problems always? This is not it. Frequently loses the tip and won't even mark in SAI. But when it does work.... hoooooly crap is it accurate. Right where the pen touches. Would I pay $650 for this again? Nope. Am I going to return it? Maybe, but the other tablets are worse. Have fun, but don't get attached.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua J.

customer_reviews.title: A nice beginner-friendly tablet.
customer_reviews.text: A nice Wacom tablet for Cintiq newbies or someone transitioning from slab tablets to screen tablets. Sturdy build and sets up easy. The screen quality is nice. There's a difference if you're used to HD screen tablets or iPads though. It's a good size and travels well. My only complaints are the lack of side buttons and zoom features. I didn't know how much I relied on either of those features until I went without. I can't say I recommend the current wacom remote either, so for now I just have to deal with it until another solution comes along.
customer_reviews.author: Crowsie

customer_reviews.title: Good drawing surface, responsive pen, color correct display
customer_reviews.text: I am so very pleased with this new Wacom Cintiq 16, and want the world to know what a precision device it is. I have been drawing with it for weeks now and reach for it immediately on every project. The price was the deciding factor in me purchasing this professional tool. Wacom made a monumentally good decision when they offered this new Cintiq to the world. If you have been holding back in purchasing a drawing tablet, and were considering another brand due to pricing, buy this product without any doubt. You will thank me for this advice, and I thank Wacom.
customer_reviews.author: Pauljs

customer_reviews.title: Poor QC
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I just got a lemon but my experience with a Cintiq 16 wasn't so great and I had to return the product. Not visible on the photos but there was a dead pixel in the middle of the screen and there was also yellow tint towards bottom of the screen and very uneven brightness on top of that. There was some parallax but it's not a big of a deal since most other display tablet would have similar parallax anyway. Although Wacom provides excellent pen tracking and accuracy but with this kind of screen quality is not acceptable as a drawing tablet in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Reonasa

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Work
customer_reviews.text: Got the device and hooked it up to my computer after installing the drivers from wacom's website. It worked for a little but the screen flickered on and off a lot before it just stopped working and started showing blue lines. I made sure it was not an issue with the HDMI port by making sure that port worked correctly with a different display.
customer_reviews.author: An Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for awhile now and I absolutely love this tablet. It has a built-in stand that works well enough for me. I had an issue with the screen display not wanting to duplicate (would result in a very small screen projection on my tablet), but after selecting “extend” instead, it works perfectly. The color difference doesn’t seem big enough to cause me problems even as someone who has been designing characters with it (and checking it on the other screen). Worth the money if you’re a hobbyist who doesn’t need the big stuff but do want a screen display tablet, though I do wish it maybe came with more granted the price
customer_reviews.author: Jeramie A Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love this display. Upgraded to this from a Wacom Intuos that was about five years old. There is a noticable improvement in the quality of my line work since the display eliminates the disconnect from the hand to the screen. The pen is a lot more comfortable in my opinion and having the eraser button on the back of the pen is great. I'm faster and better on this display and the experience is a lot more enjoyable. The screen is ever so slightly textured to prevent your pen from slipping around, almost like drawing on paper. I'd definitely save up for one if your on the fence about going from a tablet to a display.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet!
customer_reviews.text: For a casual artist like me, this tablet has been a joy to draw on. I previously had an Intuos 4 and found it difficult to draw without looking down at my hand. Having a screen makes a world of difference. The Cintiq 16 was easy to setup and pairing the tablet with a program like Clip Studio Paint has made my transition to digital drawing that much more fun. I’ve noticed no lag and the pen strokes have been accurate. Now I may finally complete those comics I started over 25 years ago!
customer_reviews.author: warlok180

customer_reviews.title: Best Tablet for Digital Artists
customer_reviews.text: I was debating between this (Wacom 16) versus Wacom 13 pro and I'm extremely happy I went with this. The size is perfect to draw on without missing any detail, and the pressure sensitivity is perfect- The pro pen 2 is fantastic to work with. If I had gone smaller I think I would have regretted it, and when I tried the Wacom 22 Pro at a college event I realized the touchscreen often has issues and I even ended up turning it off. I can't recommend this tablet enough to people who have gotten into digital art and want to take it further. Don't settle for less if you plan on drawing frequently!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: One of my best purchases ever
customer_reviews.text: I'm a photographer and bought this item for editing photo and it works great for that but I decided to try my hand at drawing. I can barely draw stick figures but as you see from the image I uploaded that this tablet makes it possible for anyone to draw. This was my first effort and it was fun and not hard at all to draw this the tablet. The pen is amazing and works perfect. Very happy with my purchase and its so worth the money spent! I highly recommend this tablet for both the photographer and the artist and for beginners as well. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Foss

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tablet. Upgraded from my Intuos Pro after 7 years just because I was craving a screen. The pro still worked really well. Wacom always does a great job and has wonderful engineering. I was worried about changing tablets because I was so happy about the Intuos but it was worth getting the Cintiq. Only critique is that it doesnt have buttons like on the intuos pro so that was annoying not to have the fast keys and it's a bit big/clunky. That said, it's not meant to be portable, so if you want something portable go with the Intuos pro or something smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Miller

customer_reviews.title: Love it but the cables are a horror show.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for hand-drawn animation in Toon Boom and Photoshop illustrations. I love it for those purposes. Color is different than the laptop screen but not too far off- it's acceptable. I also owned the 24HD and the color was terrible on that; this 16 is much better. Love the portability of it but the cables that connect it are a nightmare. Other than that it's very good.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dessel

customer_reviews.title: Bruh get it
customer_reviews.text: Its really good for the price but the screen gets scratched easily— would recommend a screen protector
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Legs are vulnerable
customer_reviews.text: I like the display, despite all the configuration problems with so many different drawing software, however, those legs stick out, and are easy to break if not very careful. I bought the other WACOM pen, and I enjoy the drawing on the display It gets marks, but comes clean quite easily. Right now my frustration at having a broken leg to hold it up is coloring my mood, so I won't say more, but I do like the display very much.
customer_reviews.author: DownyZ

customer_reviews.title: Great for mid-level illustrators and designers!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good buy! No problems in regards to technical performance. My only thing is that the screen is susceptible to scratches. I’ve used it for about two weeks and I can already see the pen strokes on my screen when the tablet isn’t on.. this isn’t noticeable when your tablet is in use because of the screen light— but still. If wacom could make their screens more scratch resistant that would be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Not "cheap," but definitely great value
customer_reviews.text: To be able to get a Cintiq for under $1000 is awesome, and it works wonderfully! It's not 4k, but considering I'm working from a non-4k laptop, that doesn't really bother me. It's a nice hefty piece of machinery that feels like the high quality stuff you expect from Wacom.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Hsieh

customer_reviews.title: Best Wacom Product Yet
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I’ve had several other Wacom devices, but this is by far the best. Great screen quality, easy to set up and use, and makes art much easier! Only downside is that it is not portable or wireless like other Wacom products, and has to be plugged in to work. Better for the stationary workspace than an artist on the go. Would definitely recommend and buy again!
customer_reviews.author: SGEIST3

customer_reviews.title: Very good with minor complaints.
customer_reviews.text: Good size display, good response, screen resolution could be better but overall a very good. All the cables and especially power supply are bulky. This could be done better.
customer_reviews.author: MyPrime

customer_reviews.title: One of the best things I own.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. My only issue is that maybe once every 20 uses or so, I have to calibrate the pen to the screen. The cursor will occasionally be several inches away from the pen tip at startup. But no problem at all! Not even a big issue. Takes a few extra minutes to do.
customer_reviews.author: Rare Reviews

customer_reviews.title: I love useing it!
customer_reviews.text: I love Wacom products this is my third and the best yet, I've only have the smaller, cheaper tablets before. I was so excited to find this at not so high a price, I can't spend thousands of dollars on my art hobby. This is a good middle road for me. It's still a bit of an investment but with the payment plan it's in my budget. The only thing I don't like is the cords: it does have its own power cord, as wall as two cords to plug into the computer. I don't have a permanent place for my laptop and tablet, so putting them up and taking them out each time is a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Maira Saw

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This product was disappointing. Not only do you need a computer to use it hardly any computers have the place for one of the cords. My daughter can't use it until we find a computer that will work with it.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Fullmer

customer_reviews.title: Pen not working
customer_reviews.text: We gave this to our daughter for her birthday yesterday and upon installing the unit we found out the pen is not working (the eraser end works, the tip does not). Called Wacom customer service, they agreed to send replacement pen. This is not a low-end product so I am quite disappointed about sending a malfunction product. Not to mention our daughter who has to wait now to even try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Szekely

customer_reviews.title: Cintiq 16
customer_reviews.text: Being that I am older and slower to learn the Cintiq was a little daunting at first. I never used a drawing tablet before but I feel I have much more control of the functions for what I purchased it for, namely photo editing with Paint Shop Pro. I would recommend this product or even the pro model or larger screen versions.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Finally a Wacom Again!
customer_reviews.text: It has been over a decade since I have had a Wacom. Man I missed it. This is a big upgrade from my old Intuos 3. I would say this is an okay for a beginner. But I wouldn't buy a beginner a Cintiq, not if they have never used even a stylus. Going back to working at home left me with only one option, buy a Cintiq. This thing is going to be a lifesaver, however these times turn out.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H.

customer_reviews.title: Great drawing tablet for beginners and experts alike!
customer_reviews.text: Not only does the screen come pre-calibrated, but the quality and texture of the screen is perfect. The pen picks up strokes really nicely, so you don't really have to worry about glitches in your line work. My only complaint is the stand for the drawing tablet is really low, so it's straining to your back. But I splurged and also purchased the WACOM Cintiq 16 stand adjuster, so that solved my issues right away. I would also recommend purchasing the drawing tablet traveling bag, as that protects my screen on the go. Overall, completely worth the price and then some. Only buying Wacom stuff from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Baylee

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: Be sure your product has arrived NON-DAMAGED
customer_reviews.text: If your product has been delivered or arrived in a damaged situation, the tablet has broken down its hardware from all the hits and bumps. The tablet will be in perfect condition if it was delivered in a safe manner to not damage the tablet. RETURN/REFUND right away if you see any damage to the box or product!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Faz

customer_reviews.title: Low level Wacom Cintiq but worth the price because of the quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet for beginners and intermediate artist. My wife loves. This is a low level Cintiq from Wacom. They did it because the competition is too strong. But my wife doesn’t have the issues others have with other brand models so I think is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Marino Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet for the price
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is a great tablet for beginners, and the price is very reasonable. A few technical issues here or there, but nothing a firmware update couldn't fix. I use this table almost daily, and I love it. I do recommend getting a digital artist glove, so your skin is sticking to the screen surface.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Dowske

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't matter which one you buy, as long as it’s a Wacom!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely beautify and equally functional addition to your art supplies. I tried one of the cheaper competitors and it failed miserably when it came to the stylus and how it interacted with the display, so I know why Wacom is the only name in digital art creation.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey E. Cahhal

customer_reviews.title: It makes my job easier
customer_reviews.text: The appearance of the tablet is very beautiful.It is itself thickness adaptive, metal shell, anti - scratch, feel good.Page turning, click very smooth, running fast, watching video color is very soft and not dazzling.High definition.I tried out the game and the speed was high.The overall feeling is good.It's worth it.There is no question about the quality.The screen looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mac book pro users
customer_reviews.text: Just a heads up, if you have a Mac book pro or any other MacBook that only has the type-c ports you’ll need to buy a kanex brand USB adapter for your Mac to register your cintiq! Any other brand WILL NOT work. That being said after I got that adapter situation figured out I was thrilled with this tablet. Great for students and hobbyists
customer_reviews.author: Megan Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: The screen surface scratches easily with the stylus basically rendering it’s main function flawed. Poor color accuracy. Overpriced. Other than that it’s pen is accurate and responsive. Can’t wait for Wacom to get killed by Apple
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I waited so long to get this. It's SO much easier to draw directly onto the screen instead of having the disconnet between screen and drawing surface that you get with a regular wacom tablet. I definitely recommend it, it's well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Thad Matheny

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect for the price. After returning 2 Huion Kamvas 22 (2019) displays I decided to spend the extra bucks for a cintiq. Absolutely the best decision I made. The Huions both had horrendous light bleed that made them absolutely worthless. They were truly garbage. Do yourself a favor and spend the extra 300.00 bucks for a quality product made by a reputable company.
customer_reviews.author: Wolverine66

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use, very great pen response and i love the screen texture
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to setup and use right away. I love how it feels when writing on the screen. It feels like writing on real paper, the texture is great. The only thing i would have love to have is buttons on the side on the tablet. I was going to buy the 13 inch tablet with touch screen but i am very glad i didn't. Sometimes, it is better to have less technology. I would have hated to have touchscreen because my hand would have constantly interact with the tablet. On this tablet that is not a problem :). Very happy customer !! It is my first drawing tablet, don't hesitate to buy :)
customer_reviews.author: Eric Duchesneau

customer_reviews.title: Nice but 3-in-1 cable is garbage
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is nice but with soooo many defective 3-in-1 cables you'd think Wacom would take steps to improve upon it. Such a pain to wait for replacement cables when you use the tablet for work.
customer_reviews.author: Nacho

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream.
customer_reviews.text: My later version broke on me when I dropped it. I ordered this one, only to find later version was repairable. The connections are much easier than later versions, it has a larger screen, and generally runs like a dream. If you are looking for a tablet - just start with this one, you'll thank yourself later.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Meier

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: The only extra thing I had to get was a HDMI spliter as my monitor only had one that I needed for another device. Incredibly easy setup. Was drawing in less than thirty minutes. I have used the more expensive Cintiq and honestly I could not tell the difference. The size was perfect for 8x10 drawings. A good value. Did I mention It was easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: G. R. Ray

customer_reviews.title: If you're a beginner, you'll eventually grow into it.
customer_reviews.text: Being able to draw directly onto the screen is a huge help for me, but if you find that your hand is getting in the way, you can set your main monitors to be duplicates and look at you main monitor while drawing. It can also double as something of a secondary monitor when not being used for drawing.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Harris

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I love finishing my sketches as digital paintings in photoshop. I love how much detail I can see on this screen compared to my iPad. I iPad Pro is sitting on a desk collecting dust ever since I switched back to having a Cintiq. I do miss the hot keys from the previous 22HD but you get used to using the keyboard shortcuts. It’s not bad. Love love love.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Your computer should have full HDMI port. If you haven’t you can’t use it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I have been waiting for something like this and now I have it. I personally don't like glassy screen for drawing and this monitor doesn't have it. So it’s a big plus for me.
customer_reviews.author: Paany

customer_reviews.title: Industry standard at a good price!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tablet I have ever used. The feel, the quality and price are a steal! I used photoshop, zbrush, substance painter and maya. It can handle any programn with ease. Very user friendly and space saving!
customer_reviews.author: eli moreno

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic drawing tablet
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Everything you would expect from a Wacom drawing tablet. Cons: The only con so far is that it did not come with mounting screws and I had to purchase some screw spacers to have it fit the screws that came with my Ergatron.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, but a big bulky mess
customer_reviews.text: My child’s review: I like the size of it, but the screen quality and the cord problem needs to be addressed. There are so many cords to plug in the tablet, and the Wacom acts like a computer. So just get an Apple Pencil and sketch on notes or something. I think I would only recommend this for expert drawers.
customer_reviews.author: Allenfire

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: It has stopped working, I have only has this for a few months and I'm very upset that I've spent all this money for it to stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a Wacom. Helloooooo
customer_reviews.text: I cannot complain about it. The price for a Wacom when I bought it on sale was a steal. No calibration was needed. My previous drawing tablet never calibrated correctly. The pen is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: PinQu

customer_reviews.title: Adjustments maybe needed for your computer or program
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend for behinners cuz there were modifications I had to make to have this run properly on my computer however after doing so it runs fine.
customer_reviews.author: Brittnie

customer_reviews.title: Good price, great quality.
customer_reviews.text: So like all other Cintiq models, the pen and screen are flawless. Just be aware that there are several connections that need to be available on your PC in order to use them. Also this is not a stand-alone product, it is technically just an additional screen cintiq does make stand-alone units if you want one. For the price on the quality this really can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my first cintiq and that's what it's perfect for. It works great, with some comromises- screen resolution and connections by cables (both are no issue for me) and the screen being a little dark which demands low light in the room for best vision of the screen (a bit annoying to say the truth...). Pen is great, size is a good balance between a compact size and a spacious work area. Over all it's a great deal for the price. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rotem Lahav

customer_reviews.title: False advertising for the bundled software.
customer_reviews.text: Got it as a gift. Cintiq 16 was adverstised as a bundle with the software Clip Studio Paint. After registering the product, the software can then be downloaded to the computer. It turns out it's only for 12 month of Clip Studio Paint Pro. I bought it from Amazon thinking it would be a legit offer. Disappointed..
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: everyone loves it
customer_reviews.text: its great with photoshop. easy to use. setting up was weird because i had to change my settings for the image to clear up, which i learned from youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Mom3boys

customer_reviews.title: Great Draw Tablet for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: If you looking for an entry level tablet for drawing you will love this Wacom Cintiq 16. You will not regret getting this tablet for your drawing and creative needs.
customer_reviews.author: La Trice Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Everything I've Expected and More
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the Bamboo CTH-670. I barely move away from my tablet. I love drawing with the Cintiq. Pen pressure is perfect. Colors look great. I use the Cintiq as my primary display unless playing games. Set up was easy and I was off and running with my art. Best decision Wacom has ever made: make Cintiq affordable. I agree with another reviewer here. Cintiq marries the relationship an artist has with a pencil and paper to the digital sphere. My drawings look the same from my mixed media sketchbook to my digital canvas.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Fuzes

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Love this art tablet, only issue i have is the amount of cables is a little annoying but its not something you can escape really. Great price.

product_meta.title: Wacom Cintiq 16 Drawing Tablet with Screen (DTK1660K0A)
product_meta.description: Size:Small| Style:Drawing TabletWacom Cintiq is a creative pen display that helps you bring your ideas to life on screen. Perfect for those who love to draw in their spare time or art/design students seeking a Premium on screen experience. This high resolution (1920x1080) drawing tablet with screen display comes with the super responsive Wacom Pro Pen 2, giving you the precision and control you desire. It's 8, 192 levels of pressure sensitivity and a low activation Force, recognizes even the lightest pen strokes and with reduced parallax, your cursor appears exactly where you would expect. Built of durable, scratch resistant materials, Wacom Cintiq drawing monitor attaches easily to your Mac or PC with a simple 3 in1 Cable and is a graphics tablet with screen you can rely on day after day.
feature_bullets: A more affordable pen Display with Wacom Pro Pen 2 technology, 8,192 pressure levels and tilt recognition; It's amazing precision and reduced Parallax provide the most natural drawing experience
Cintiq’s 15.6 inch 1920x1080 HD display provides you with clarity to see every detail of your work; The scratch resistant Anti-Glare surface prevents distracting reflections as you create

See your creations in vibrant color on the Cintiq’s HD display (16.7 million colors bit, 72 percentage NTSC/Cie1931 typical); Work as long as you'd like with the battery free pen that charges off the screen while you create
Connect to your computer with the convenient 3 in 1 (HDMI) connection cable and get into the perfect position with foldable legs that let you adjust how you want to work; Brightness 250 cd/m2
